intro: Dyssodia porophylloides, commonly known as the hairy dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in dry environments. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in clusters, and they bloom in late summer. Dyssodia porophylloides is often found growing on rocky soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall.
